meaning_str.bing:
n. 野心；雄心；抱负；志向
v. 热望
网络. 雄心壮志；志气

抱负；志向；雄心；野心；夙愿；渴望；追求的目标；理想；企图；愿望；生涯目标；事业心
追求（目标或成就）；有…野心；努力获得；热望

1.en: "When I got to Washington, my ambition was to be as influential as the ambassador from Norway, " a Polish diplomat at the time told me.
1.cn: “当我到华盛顿时，我的志向是拥有像挪威大使那样的影响力。”当时的一名波兰外交官告诉我。

2.en: This issue is often a great opportunity for you to pursue a particular personal ambition.
2.cn: 这件事情往往是实现你个人抱负的一个好机会。

3.en: When it comes to planting trees in the desert, unfortunately, mad ambition is often its own reward.
3.cn: 然而很遗憾，在沙漠中植树通常只有一个成果：疯狂膨胀的野心。

0.en: In competition, individual ambition serves the common good.
0.cn: “在竞争中，个人的雄心是为了公共的利益。”

1.en: He sailed the yacht out of danger and into his future. Gatsby showed skill and ambition. And for five years, they sailed the world.
1.cn: 他开着游艇驶离了危险，也驶向了未来，富豪看到了他的技巧和雄心，五年里，他们航遍了世界。

2.en: A young, untested leader with nuclear ambition. Kim Jong-un.
2.cn: 年轻，放荡不羁，有着实现核武的野心，他就是金正恩。

3.en: Go. If serving as a glorified bodyguard is the sum of your ambition, go serve.
3.cn: 去吧，如果当个高级护卫就是你的全部志向，那就去当你的。

4.en: Listen, blonde ambition. I know you only want me to get one, so you can use it at your cupcake window.
4.cn: 听着，野心美女，我就知道你想让我掏钱买，你们就能用在自己的蛋糕售货窗了。

5.en: And for what purpose? The blind ambition of a Mountain King, so driven by greed, he could not see beyond his own desire!
5.cn: 都是为了什么，为了山下之王盲目的野心，贪婪蒙蔽了他的双眼，他心里只有欲望。

6.en: It is not that I've changed, Robert, that ambition has clouded anything. It is that I was blind to this until now, what I am meant to be.
6.cn: 并不是我变了，罗伯特，并不是我被野心蒙蔽了双眼。而是我之前都没有意识到我注定应该做什么。
